title: KSI vs Logan Paul rematch: YouTube Stream, when is the fight, where and how to buy tickets
text:
KSI and Logan Paul are set to do battle again in 2019, after the pair first met in what was described as the “biggest internet event in history” last year.

Prior to the Manchester Arena bout in August, both the YouTube stars had already penned an agreement for a two-fight deal, although the location for the second was up for discussion, and widely expected to be in the US.

The pair, with a combined subscriber count of over 40 million, fought to a controversial majority draw, meaning that KSI retained his “YouTube Championship Belt” after initially winning it against Brit rival Joe Weller.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

After more than 18,000 people watched the first contest in Manchester and another 800,000 or so live, interest in seeing who would come out on top in the rematch has been high – but will it happen? Here’s everything you need to know.

When will the rematch happen?

It was widely believed that the first fight would happen at some point early in 2019, likely February, but soon after facing Paul, KSI admitted that he wanted an extended break away from the ring to recover and that it would be sometime “in the summer” – having fought twice in 2018, it’s understandable.

The bout is set to take place on 9th November, 2019. We're not too far off then.

Where will the rematch take place?

The fight between the two YouTube sensations will take place at the Staples Centre in Los Angeles, California. The first went down at the MEN Arena in Manchester, so this time it's on Logan's turf.

How can I get tickets?

Demand for the first fight was somewhat unprecedented and sold out the Manchester Arena, so if you like the idea of being around 18,000 screaming kids for hours then you’ll have to act fast. They’ll be sold in the same places as the first fight, their joint website and the website of the venue it will be held at, so keep your eyes peeled.

Where will I be able to watch the fight?

The distribution for this one may not be as straightforward as the first fight and that’s simply because of the demand. The two YouTube stars created a joint channel where they charged £7.50 per viewer to watch, later releasing it for free and it has now been viewed in total over 20 million times – staggering numbers considering it was an amateur bout. It will almost certainly be streamed on YouTube via the same channel but with it now promoted by Eddie Hearn and Matchroom Boxing, expect it to land on DAZN in America and your screens elsewhere in the UK.

What have they said since the first fight?

KSI: “Logan is saying I’m trying to dodge the rematch, that I don’t want to fight. I have ignored everything. November is the ideal date for both of us to train and concentrate on our careers, I want to release more music.”

Logan Paul: “He’s not gonna make it past two rounds, absolutely gonna knock him out. If he doesn’t bitch out.”
